definition:
An $n$-dimensional arithmetic progresssion is a set of the form
$$\begin{aligned}
Q&=Q(a; q_1, \dotsc, q_n; l_1, \dotsc, l_n)\\
 &=\{\,a+x_1 q_1+\dotsb+x_n q_n \mid 0\leq x_i<l_i\text{ for } i=1,\dotsc,n \,\}.\end{aligned}$$
The length of the progression is defined as $l_1\dotsb l_n$. The
progression is *proper* if $|Q|=l_1\dotsb l_n$.

[1]{}

Melvyn B. Nathanson. , volume 165 of [*GTM*]{}. Springer, 1996. .
